Bash(.specify/scripts/powershell/create-new-feature.ps1 -Json "AI Todo Chatbot Integration for The Evolution of Todo - Phase III: Full-Stack Web Application
Target audience: Hackathon judges seeking groundbreaking, production-grade AI integrations; developers building flagship intelligent productivity apps; and AI agents delivering flawless execution via Claude Code.
Focus: Define exhaustive, zero-ambiguity, flagship-level specifications for integrating a powerful, natural-language AI Todo Chatbot into the existing full-stack application \(Next.js frontend + FastAPI backend + Neon DB + Better Auth\). The chatbot must have full control over all core task operations \(add, delete, update, mark complete, list\) and user information \(e.g., "Who am I?" -> reply with logged-in email\), using Cohere API \(not OpenAI/Gemini\) for all AI reasoning and tool calling. Adapt agent-style logic from the provided OpenAI Agents SDK example to Cohere''s chat/completions endpoint. The chatbot UI must be beautifully integrated into the existing premium frontend with a floating chatbot icon/button that opens a stunning, responsive chat panel -- maintaining visual harmony with the flagship UI.
Success criteria: Deliverase Extensions for Conversations, Backend Chat Endpoint, Frontend Chatbot UI Integration, Natural Language Examples & Flows, Security & User Isolation, Error Handling & Confirmations, TypeScript/Frontend Types, Acceptance Criteria, Detailed Wireframes & Interaction Flows\).
Version: v1.0, include current date \(January 06, 2026\).
AI Provider: Cohere API only \(via COHERE_API_KEY\) -- no OpenAI, Gemini, or other models.
Tools: Adapt agent logic using Cohere chat completions: prompt model to reason step-by-step, output structured JSON for tool calls, parse and execute.
Dependencies: Existing stack + cohere python library, no OpenAI Agents SDK.
Frontend Integration: Add chatbot trigger button \(floating action, premium design\), beautiful chat panel \(glassmorphic, themed bubbles, scrollable history\), real-time message streaming if possible.
Stateless backend: No server-held conversation state -- persist everything in DB \(Conversation + Message models\).
Use async operations throughout backend.
Keep specs visionary yet surgically implementable \(under 4000 words\).

Specific Requirements:

Cohere API Adaptation
Replace OpenAI Agents SDK with direct Cohere chat calls.
Prompt engineering: Instruct Cohere to think step-by-step, identify intent, output JSON tool call if needed, or respond directly.
Parse Cohere response for tool invocation \(JSON block\), execute tool, feed result back if multi-step needed.

MCP-Style Tools \(6 total\)
add_task, delete_task, update_task, complete_task, list_tasks \(as before\)
get_current_user -> returns {""email"": str, ""user_id"": str}

Database Extensions
Conversation: id, user_id, created_at
Message: id, conversation_id, role \(""user""/""assistant""\), content, created_at

Backend Endpoint
POST /api/{user_id}/chat
Body: {conversation_id \(optional\), message: str}
Response: {conversation_id, response: str, tool_calls: array \(optional\)}

Frontend UI
Floating chatbot button \(bottom-right, emerald accent, subtle pulse animation\)
Slide-in chat panel \(glassmorphic card, dark/light theme aware\)
Message bubbles: user \(right, indigo\), assistant \(left, slate\), with timestamps
Input bar with send button \(SVG paper plane\)
Typing indicator, scroll to bottom, loading states

Natural Language Handling
Full coverage: adding tasks with/without description, listing with filters, completing/deleting by title or ID, updating, asking about self.

Not building:
Actual code \(reserved for agents\).
Voice input, file attachments, real-time streaming beyond basic.
Custom Cohere fine-tuning.

Generate immediately -- this specification must guarantee the creation of the most intelligent, beautiful, and seamlessly integrated AI Todo chatbot in hackathon history. Absolute flagship quality. No compromises." -Number 4 -ShortName "ai-chatbot")

Bash(.specify/scripts/powershell/create-new-feature.ps1 -Json "Local Kubernetes Deployment & Cloud-Native Setup for The Evolution of Todo - Phase IV

Target audience: Hackathon judges looking for jaw-dropping cloud-native mastery, elite DevOps engineers judging AI-assisted infrastructure, and the full agentic team \(Docker Engineer, Helm Chart Engineer, Kubernetes Deploy Agent, AIOps Troubleshooter, Infra Spec Writer, K8s Validation Agent\) executing via Claude Code in a monorepo.

Focus: Define an absolutely ruthless, production-grade, no-excuses specification for containerizing the entire Phase III Todo AI Chatbot \(Next.js frontend + FastAPI backend + Cohere-powered chatbot\) and deploying it on a local Kubernetes cluster \(Minikube\) using Helm charts, Docker \(with Gordon AI\), kubectl-ai, and kagent — all in a pure spec-driven, agentic workflow with ZERO manual coding. The final result must run flawlessly on Minikube, look like enterprise-grade infrastructure, and scream "this person understands modern cloud-native DevOps at an elite level".

Success criteria:

Produces a bullet-proof, demo-dominating Kubernetes deployment that:
- Containerizes frontend & backend with optimized multi-stage Dockerfiles \(leveraging Gordon AI wherever possible\)
- Uses AI-generated Helm charts \(via kubectl-ai / kagent\) with best-practice values, resources, probes, HPA readiness
- Deploys successfully on Minikube with port-forward / ingress access
- Survives pod crashes, scaling, restarts — validated by AIOps agents
- Shows intelligent troubleshooting & optimization using kubectl-ai and kagent in real-time
- Generates a complete Markdown file \(v1_k8s_deployment.spec.md\) in specs/deployment/ — so ruthlessly detailed that every agent \(Docker Engineer → Helm Chart Engineer → Kubernetes Deploy Agent → AIOps Troubleshooter\) can execute their part with 100% fidelity and zero deviation
- The deployed app must feel like a real cloud product running locally: fast startup, auto-healing, observable, beautiful logs

All agents and skills MUST be actively used:
- Docker Engineer Agent + Gordon Dockerfile Generator skill
- Helm Chart Engineer Agent + AI Helm Chart Creator skill
- Kubernetes Deploy Agent + Minikube Deploy Skill
- AIOps Troubleshooter Agent + kubectl-ai Troubleshooter + kagent Health Analyzer skills
- K8s Validation Agent + Deployment Validator skill

Constraints:

Format: Markdown with military-grade structure  
\(Metadata, Deployment Vision & Success Bar, Agents & Skills Mandate, Containerization Specs \(Docker + Gordon\), Helm Chart Blueprint, Minikube Cluster Requirements, AI DevOps Workflow \(kubectl-ai + kagent\), Security & Best Practices, Validation & Observability Checklist, Acceptance Criteria, Detailed Command Sequences & Expected Outputs, Troubleshooting Decision Tree\)

Version: v1.0, date January 14, 2026

Dependencies strictly limited to:
- Docker Desktop \(with Gordon Beta enabled if available\)
- Minikube
- Helm 3+
- kubectl-ai
- kagent
- Existing app \(Phase III\)

No manual YAML/Dockerfile writing — everything AI/agent-generated

Keep specs exhaustive, surgical, and intimidating \(under 3800 words\)

Reference constitution.md v4.0 and Phase III specs

Prioritize:
- Multi-stage, minimal-size images
- Resource requests/limits
- Liveness/readiness probes
- Graceful shutdown
- Observability \(logs, events\)

Not building:
- Actual Dockerfiles, Helm charts, kubectl commands \(reserved for agents\)
- Cloud clusters \(EKS/GKE\) — strictly local Minikube
- CI/CD pipelines \(save for future phase\)

Generate immediately — this specification must force the creation of the most impressive, AI-powered, cloud-native local deployment ever seen in a hackathon. No mercy. No shortcuts.
